title: Introduction to Ledger1CMS
content:
# Introduction to Ledger1CMS

Welcome to **Ledger1CMS**, the all-in-one Artificial Intelligence-assisted Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) platform designed specifically to empower Main Street businesses with the sophisticated technology typically reserved for Fortune 500 companies.

## Making Enterprise Tech Accessible

In today's fast-paced digital economy, data is the new oil. However, most small to medium-sized businesses (SMBs) struggle with fragmented systems—using one tool for email, one for invoicing, another for project management, and spreadsheets for everything else. This fragmentation leads to:
*   **Data Silos**: Information locked in different apps.
*   **Inefficiency**: Constant context switching.
*   **Lost Revenue**: Leads falling through the cracks.

**Ledger1CMS solves this** by unifying your entire business operation into a single, intelligent OS.

## Core Capabilities

Ledger1CMS is not just a CRM; it's a complete business engine.

### 1. Sales Intelligence
Stop guessing. Our AI analyzes your interactions to predict which leads are most likely to convert.
*   **Pipeline Management**: Visual Kanban boards for deals.
*   **Automated Scoring**: AI-driven lead scoring based on interaction depth.

### 2. Operational Efficiency
*   **Project Boards**: Manage tasks, files, and team collaboration in one place.
*   **Invoicing**: Generate contracts and invoices instantly from closed deals.

### 3. AI-First Design
We didn't just bolt AI on top; we built the platform around it.
*   **VoiceHub**: Deploy AI agents that can talk to your customers on the phone.
*   **Smart Chat**: An omnipresent assistant that knows your business context.

## Navigation Overview

*   **Dashboard**: Your command center with high-level KPIs.
*   **CRM**: Contacts, Companies, and Deals.
*   **Projects**: Task management and deliverables.
*   **VoiceHub**: AI voice agent configuration.
*   **Documents**: Central file storage and contract management.
*   **Settings**: System configuration, integrations, and user management.

## Need Help?

Our support team is available 24/7.
*   **Docs**: You are here!
*   **Email**: support@ledger1.ai
*   **Discord**: Join our community for real-time help.

title: Initial Setup & Configuration
content:
# Initial Setup & Configuration

Configure your workspace to match your business processes. Spending a few minutes here will save you hours later.

## 1. Company Profile

Navigate to **Settings > My Account**. This information is critical as it appears on official documents like Invoices and Quotes.
*   **Company Name**: Legal business name.
*   **Tax/VAT ID**: Required for compliant invoicing.
*   **Address**: Global headquarters.
*   **Currency**: Your primary operating currency (e.g., USD, EUR).

## 2. Branding (White Labeling)

Ledger1CMS allows you to brand the client-facing experience.
*   **Logo**: Upload a high-resolution PNG (transparent background recommended).
*   **Colors**: Set your primary brand color. This affects button styles on Invoices and Portals.

## 3. Integrations

Connect your ecosystem in **Settings > Integrations**.

### Google Workspace
Connect your Google Account to enable:
*   **Email Sync**: Two-way sync of email threads attached to contacts.
*   **Calendar**: View and edit your Google Calendar directly in the CRM.

### OpenAI (Optional)
By default, Ledger1CMS uses a shared pool of AI credits. For heavy usage, input your own API Key:
1.  Go to [platform.openai.com](https://platform.openai.com).
2.  Generate a new Secret Key.
3.  Paste it into **Settings > Integrations > OpenAI**.

## 4. User Management

Invite your team in **Admin > Users**.
*   **Roles**:
    *   **Admin**: Full access to all settings and data.
    *   **Manager**: Can view all data but cannot change system settings.
    *   **Sales**: Can only view their own leads and opportunities (if "Private" mode is on).
*   **Invitation**: Users receive an email with a secure link to set their password.

## 5. Module Selection

Keep your interface clean by enabling only what you use in **Settings > Modules**.
*   *Recommended for Sales Teams*: CRM, VoiceHub, Inbox.
*   *Recommended for Agencies*: CRM, Projects, Invoicing.

title: Contacts & Accounts Deep Dive
content:
# Contacts & Accounts: The Relationship Engine

Manage your business ecosystem with granular control over people and organizations.

## The Data Model

Ledger1CMS uses a B2B data model:
*   **Accounts**: Organizations, Companies, or Households. This is the parent entity.
*   **Contacts**: Individuals. A contact can be standalone or linked to an Account.

## Managing Accounts

### Creating an Account
1.  Click **+ New** in the top nav or **New Account** in the Accounts list.
2.  **Enrichment**: Enter a domain (e.g., `tesla.com`), and our AI will attempt to auto-fill details like Industry, Revenue, and Address.

### The Account View
The 360-degree view gives you everything you need to know:
*   **Header**: Key stats (Total Revenue, Open Deals).
*   **Timeline**: A chronological history of every email, call, note, and task.
*   **Related Lists**: Linked Contacts, Opportunities, and Invoices.

## Managing Contacts

### Segmentation
Don't just stare at a list. Use **Smart Views** to segment your audience.
*   *Example*: "CEOs in California" -> Filter by `Job Title contains CEO` AND `Location contains CA`.
*   **Save View**: Save detailed filters as a dedicated tab for quick access.

### Activity Logging
*   **Email**: Send emails directly from the contact card. Templates are available for standard responses.
*   **Calls**: If using VoiceHub, call logs and recordings appear automatically.
*   **Notes**: Use `@mentions` to notify team members in a note (e.g., "@Sarah check this out").

## Importing Data

Migrating from Salesforce or HubSpot?
1.  Go to **Settings > Import**.
2.  Upload a **CSV** file.
3.  **Map Fields**: Match your CSV columns to Ledger1CMS fields.
4.  **Review**: The system will flag duplicates before finalizing the import.

title: Leads & Pipeline Management
content:
# Leads & Pipeline: Accelerating Revenue

Turn cold prospects into loyal customers using our visual pipeline and AI tools.

## Lead vs. Opportunity

It is crucial to understand the distinction:
*   **Lead**: Unqualified potential. A name on a list. They might not be interested yet.
*   **Opportunity (Deal)**: A qualified prospect with a defined value and timeline. They are actively engaged in a buying cycle.

## Lead Management

### Best Practices
1.  **Speed to Lead**: Use the **Lead Inbox** to see new inquiries immediately.
2.  **Qualification**: Use the BANT framework (Budget, Authority, Need, Timeline) in your notes.
3.  **Conversion**: Once a lead is qualified, click **Convert**. This performs three actions:
    *   Creates a **Contact**.
    *   Creates an **Account**.
    *   (Optional) Creates an **Opportunity**.

## Opportunity Pipeline

### Kanban View
The drag-and-drop interface allows you to move deals across stages:
*   **Identify**: Initial discovery.
*   **Engagement (AI/Human)**: Active conversation.
*   **Offering**: Proposal sent.
*   **Negotiation**: Finalizing terms.
*   **Closed Won/Lost**: The endgame.

### Forecasting
Ledger1CMS calculates **Expected Revenue** automatically:
`Deal Value * Stage Probability = Expected Revenue`
*   *Example*: A $10,000 deal in "Negotiation" (90% probability) adds $9,000 to your forecast.

### Stalled Deals
The system highlights deals that haven't had activity in 14+ days with a **warning icon**. Filter by "Stagnant" to proactively rescue these deals.

title: Invoices, Contracts & Payments
content:
# Invoices, Contracts, and Payments

Close the loop by turning signed deals into cash in the bank.

## The Billing Workflow

1.  **Deal Closed**: You mark an Opportunity as "Won".
2.  **Generate Contract**: Create a contract from the deal using a template.
3.  **Generate Invoice**: Convert the accepted proposal into an invoice.
4.  **Payment**: Client pays via PortalPay.

## Invoicing Power User Features

### Recurring Invoices
Perfect for SaaS and Retainers.
*   Set the **Interval** (Monthly, Yearly).
*   Set **Auto-Send**: Automatically email the invoice to the billing contact on the renewal date.

### Global Tax Support
*   Configure Tax Rates in Settings.
*   Apply multiple taxes (e.g., State + Local) to line items.
*   **Multi-Currency**: Issue invoices in EUR while your base currency is USD. the system handles the exchange rate recording.

## Contracts & E-Signatures

Stop paying for DocuSign. Ledger1CMS has it built-in.
1.  **Upload PDF** or generate from HTML template.
2.  **Place Fields**: Drag and drop Signature, Date, and Text fields.
3.  **Send**: Recipient receives a secure link.
4.  **Audit Trail**: Once signed, a certificate of completion is attached to the Contract record.

## PortalPay

Give your clients a professional portal to manage their relationship with you.
*   **History**: Clients can download past invoices.
*   **Payment**: Accepts Credit Cards (Stripe) and Crypto (ETH/USDC).
*   **Profile**: Clients can update their own billing address and contact info.

title: Outreach & Campaigns
content:
# Outreach & Campaigns: Automated Growth

Scale your sales development with multi-channel sequences and AI personalization.

## Understanding Sequences

A **Sequence** is a series of automated steps executed over time.
*   *Day 1*: Send Email 1.
*   *Day 3*: If no reply, send Email 2.
*   *Day 5*: Create "Call Task" for sales rep.

## AI Personalization

Generic templates get ignored. Our AI engine personalizes every email.
*   **Icebreakers**: The AI scrapes the prospect's LinkedIn profile and company news to write a unique opening sentence.
*   **Context Injection**: References their industry challenges dynamically.

### Setting Up a Campaign
1.  **Audience**: Select a Lead List or Segment.
2.  **Steps**: Build your workflow.
3.  **Schedule**: Set sending windows (e.g., "Mon-Fri, 9am-5pm EST").
4.  **Launch**: The system drip-feeds emails to avoid spam filters.

## Deliverability Protection

We protect your domain reputation.
*   **Ramp-Up**: Gradually increases sending volume for new accounts.
*   **Unsubscribe**: Automatically handles one-click unsubscribe headers.
*   **Bounce Handling**: Pauses sending to a contact if an email bounces.

## Analytics

Track the metrics that matter:
*   **Open Rate**: Subject line effectiveness.
*   **Reply Rate**: Pitch effectiveness.
*   **Meeting Rate**: The ultimate goal.

title: VoiceHub: AI Voice Agents
content:
# VoiceHub: The Future of Telephony

VoiceHub allows you to deploy "Digital Employees"—AI agents capable of holding complex, natural voice conversations over the phone.

## Capabilities

*   **Inbound Routing**: Replace "Press 1 for Sales" with "How can I help you?". The AI routes the call or solves the problem itself.
*   **Outbound Power Dialing**: Have the AI call leads to qualify them. If a human answers and shows interest, the AI can transfer the call to you.
*   **24/7 Availability**: Your AI agent never sleeps, takes breaks, or gets tired.

## Creating an Agent

### 1. Persona & Voice
*   Choose a voice from our library of 100+ realistic neural voices.
*   Adjust **Stability** and **Similarity** to control emotional range.

### 2. The System Prompt
This is the "brain" of the agent.
*   **Role**: "You are Sarah, a helpful support agent for Acme Corp."
*   **Goal**: "Your goal is to schedule a demo."
*   **Knowledge**: "Here is our pricing: Basic is $10, Pro is $20..."

### 3. Functions (Tools)
Give the agent capability to *do* things, not just talk.
*   **Calendar**: Allow the agent to check your availability and book slots.
*   **CRM**: Allow the agent to update lead status during the call.

## Compliance

*   **Recording**: Options to auto-announce "This call is recorded".
*   **Do Not Call**: Automatically checks lists before dialing.

title: Tasks & Project Management
content:
# Tasks & Project Management

Stop paying for Monday.com or Trello. Ledger1CMS includes a robust Project Management suite integrated with your client data.

## Boards

Boards are the top-level containers for work.
*   **Views**: Switch between **Kanban** (Columns), **List** (Excel-style), and **Gantt** (Timeline).
*   **Permissions**: Public (Team), Private, or Shared (External Clients).

## Task Anatomy

A task is more than a checkbox.
*   **Assignees**: Multiple users can own a task.
*   **Due Dates**: Supports Start Date, Due Date, and Reminders.
*   **Checklists**: Break tasks into sub-steps.
*   **Dependencies**: Blocking and blocking-by relationships.

## Client Collaboration

You can invite your clients to a specific Board as **Guests**.
*   They see *only* that board.
*   They can comment approvals and upload design assets.
*   This keeps communication out of email and in the context of the work.

## Automation

*   "When Task is moved to 'Done', email the Manager."
*   "When Task is Overdue, increase Priority to High."

title: Email & Calendar Integration
content:
# Email & Calendar Integration

The **Unified Inbox** brings all your communications into one place, linked to your CRM data.

## The Unified Inbox

Navigate to **Inbox** to see all your email accounts.
*   **Threads**: Emails are threaded naturally.
*   **Sidebar Context**: When you open an email, the sidebar shows the sender's CRM profile, recent deals, and active tasks.
*   **Snooze**: Snooze emails to come back to the top of your inbox later.

## Calendar Sync

*   **Bi-Directional**: Create an event in Ledger1, it shows in Google. Edit in Google, it updates in Ledger1.
*   **Meeting Notes**: Click on any meeting to open a collaborative notepad. Notes are automatically attached to the attendees' contact records.

## Scheduling Links

Replace Calendly with built-in efficient scheduling.
1.  **Create Event Type**: "30 Min Demo".
2.  **Set Availability**: Define your working hours.
3.  **Share Link**: `ledger1.ai/meet/yourname/demo`
4.  **Booking Flow**: When a client books, it creates a Zoom link, sends invites, creates a Contact if they are new, and logs the activity.

title: AI Chat Assistant
content:
# AI Chat Assistant: Your Co-Pilot

Ledger1CMS features a persistent AI Chat interface accessible via `Cmd+K` or the chat icon.

## Context Awareness

Unlike ChatGPT, our AI knows your business data.
*   *Context*: If you are on a Contact page, the AI implicitly knows you are talking about that person.
    *   **User**: "Draft an intro email."
    *   **AI**: "Drafting email to John Doe at Acme Corp..."

## RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation)

The AI can search your entire database.
*   **Query**: "Show me all deals over $10k closing this month."
*   **Response**: The AI queries the database and presents a formatted table of results.

## Actions

The AI can perform actions for you.
*   "Create a task to call Mike tomorrow at 2pm."
*   "Update the status of the Tesla deal to Negotiation."
*   "Summarize the last 5 calls with Susan."

## Configuration

*   **Model Selection**: Choose between speed (3.5-Turbo) or intelligence (GPT-4 / Claude 3).
*   **System Prompt**: Customize the AI's tone and strictness in Settings.

title: Automated Lead Generation
content:
# Automated Lead Generation

Fill your pipeline while you sleep. The Lead Gen module is an automated scraper and enrichment engine.

## How it Works

1.  **Define Target**: Set criteria (e.g., "Architecture Firms", "London", "10-50 Employees").
2.  **Sources**: The engine scours multiple data sources including Google Maps, LinkedIn, and Corporate Registries.
3.  **Extraction**: It extracts Name, Website, and Phone.
4.  **Enrichment**: It visits their website and social profiles to find Decision Makers (CEO, Founder).
5.  **Verification**: It guesses email patterns (e.g., `first.last@company.com`) and pings the server to verify existence.

## Job Management

*   **Queuing**: Large jobs run in the background. You will be notified when complete.
*   **Review Mode**: Scraped leads land in a "Candidate" pool. You must manually review and "Approve" them to move them to your main CRM. This keeps your database clean.

## Cost & Credits

Lead Gen consumes **Credits**.
*   Basic Scrape: 1 Credit
*   Email Enrichment: 5 Credits
*   Mobile Number Decode: 10 Credits

title: API Reference for Developers
content:
# API Reference

Ledger1CMS is built on an API-first architecture. Everything you can do in the UI, you can do via the API.

## Authentication

We use **Bearer Token** authentication.
1.  Generate an API Key in **Settings > Developer**.
2.  Include it in the header: `Authorization: Bearer sk_live_...`

## Base URL

`https://api.ledger1crm.com/v1`

## Rate Limits

*   **Standard**: 100 requests / minute.
*   **Enterprise**: 1,000 requests / minute.
*   Headers `X-RateLimit-Remaining` and `X-RateLimit-Reset` are included in responses.

## Core Endpoints

### Contacts
```http
GET /contacts
POST /contacts
GET /contacts/{id}
PATCH /contacts/{id}
DELETE /contacts/{id}
```
*Query Parameters*: `?limit=20&page=1&email=test@example.com`

### Deals
```http
GET /opportunities
POST /opportunities
```

### Webhooks

Subscribe to events to trigger real-time workflows.
*   **Events**: `contact.created`, `deal.updated`, `invoice.paid`.
*   **Security**: Validate signatures using the `X-Signature` header.

## SDKs

Official libraries are available:
*   **Node.js**: `npm install @ledger1/sdk`
*   **Python**: `pip install ledger1-crm`
